intro: Leucas mollissima var. scaberula, commonly known as rough leucas, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features aromatic, softly hairy leaves that are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
